layers_all.caption: The image is an infographic titled "The Great Barrier Reef: A Natural Wonder of the World". This infographic presents key facts about the Great Barrier Reef in a visually engaging and informative layout, using a combination of text and illustrations to guide the viewer through its ecological and historical significance. At the top left, the text "<The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system>" is prominently displayed, positioned above the main visual elements. In the upper left section, a cartoon of a coral reef with a large sign showing 'world's largest coral reef system' in stylized shapes is placed, anchoring the visual theme. Centered in the middle section, a cartoon of a vibrant underwater scene with a variety of fish in different colors captures the biodiversity of the reef. To the right of this, a cartoon of a coral reef with a variety of coral types in different shapes and colors highlights the reef's structural diversity. Below the fish illustration, the text "<It spans over 2,300 kilometers along the northeastern coast of Australia>" is placed at the lower left, complementing the visual of the reef's vast expanse. On the right side, a cartoon of a coral reef with a UNESCO emblem and a plaque showing '1981' in stylized shapes is positioned, visually reinforcing the text "<The reef is a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1981>". Further down, the text "<It supports over 400 species of coral>" is placed at the lower right, adjacent to the coral illustration. Finally, the text "<The reef is home to more than 1,500 species of fish>" is located in the lower middle, directly below the fish illustration. The overall style of the image is a playful yet informative cartoon style with bright colors and stylized elements that make the information easily digestible and visually engaging.

layers_all.caption: The image is an infographic titled "The Great Barrier Reef: A Natural Wonder of the World". This infographic presents key facts about the Great Barrier Reef through a combination of text and visual elements, arranged in a clear and informative layout. At the top left, the text "<The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system>" is placed, while directly below it, "<It spans over 2,300 kilometers along the northeastern coast of Australia>" is positioned in the upper middle section. In the upper left section, a cartoon of a coral reef with a large, intricate structure in the foreground is displayed, anchoring the visual narrative. To the right of this, a cartoon map showing a long, curved line along the northeastern coast of Australia is placed, aligning with the textual information about the reef's geographic extent. In the middle section, "<The reef is home to more than 1,500 species of fish>" is centered, with a cartoon of various colorful fish swimming around a coral structure placed just below it. On the right side, a cartoon of different coral types with vibrant colors and textures is shown, complementing the text "<It supports over 400 species of coral>" which is positioned above it. Below that, "<The reef is a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1981>" is located, with a cartoon of a star-shaped emblem with the words 'UNESCO World Heritage Site' around it placed just beneath it. The overall style of the image is clean, bright, and informative, with a cartoonish aesthetic that makes the content accessible and engaging.
